page.title: 11ATTITUDES IN BEDWORTH
page.content: Within the "village" areas of our block,there are many suggestions for improving standards & facilities, although many residents appear satisfied.People want to see greater provision for the young & old, e.g. play facilities with supervision, youth clubs & a community hall."It is a village community without the assets".People are also concerned with the attraction of the area.It should be tidier,there should be more shrubs & trees & people should be fined for letting dogs loose.Other concerns include the lack of local shops (especially a chemist),poor pavements & the need for more adult evening classes.The neighbourhood is greatly concerned with the increase in crime, more especially petty rule-breaking such as motor cycles & cars being driven on local playing fields.
